messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Not eating meat
messages.msgSnippet: ... That s so perfect. It made me grab my guys, hug them, and tell them they are absolutely perfect and I adore them. Thank you ;) Peace, Jean Elizabeth
messages.messageBody:
>
> I long, long ago gave up the belief that if we unschooled, my children
> would be little peace-loving, calm hippies, eco-aware, nonviolent and
> oh, so sweet. They are who they are, completely and totally, and I
> LOVE every molecule.
>
> Caren



That's so perfect. It made me grab my guys, hug them, and tell them they are
absolutely perfect and I adore them.

Thank you ;)

Peace,
Jean Elizabeth

http://3mommies.blogspot.com

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Not eating meat
messages.msgSnippet: unschoolingbasicsWhew! Another goal I don t have to aim for. Thanks! :) Nance I long, long ago gave up the belief that if we unschooled, my children would be
messages.messageBody:
unschoolingbasicsWhew! Another goal I don't have to aim for. Thanks! :)

Nance



I long, long ago gave up the belief that if we unschooled, my children
would be little peace-loving, calm hippies, eco-aware, nonviolent and
oh, so sweet. They are who they are, completely and totally, and I
LOVE every molecule.

Caren


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Not eating meat
messages.msgSnippet: unschoolingbasicsLOL -- she may feel the same way I do, that chickens are yummy! Or is that the concern? Like a very religious person not wanting their child
messages.messageBody:
unschoolingbasicsLOL -- she may feel the same way I do, that chickens are yummy!

Or is that the concern? Like a very religious person not wanting their child to learn about other religions? The child may figure out something other than what the parents are ready to accept?

Nance



How will she feel about chickens when she finds out the truth??
Janis in East Providence, RI
